title: In game fun facts
body: “players who curse at their teammates lose 13% more games”- well yeah thats because players who are already losing are the ones cursing at their teammates, Duh!

replies.body: More like they make 13% less comebacks, scrub. If you're ready to curse your team, you already partially surrendered.

My issue with the tips is that most of them deal with the correlation=/=causation affair when they could be easing the burden of knowledge or actually helping people play better, not giving them some superstitious hope that if they refrain from swearing theyll magically play better

My favorite tip is "You can rename rune pages by clicking on the name when editing them."
That knowledge has made me OP in my circles, wrecking all my friends.

Lack of teamwork is what loses a game, at least in low ELO. If you're negative and cursing (especially against someone who doesn't deserve it—and no matter how dumb he may be, that 0/4/2 Mundo botlane is not feeding so much as sucking), you work to destroy the potential teamwork later on that actually matters. (Both of my last games, actually, have been completely stupid, like, behind 20 kills, and we came back and won, only to find out post-game that the enemy team was super toxic to each other.)

Cursing at teammates isn't a guaranteed loss, but it definitely helps nothing and arguably hurts your chances.

Nope; AFKs, non-connectors, DCs, non english-speakers, grievously underskilled mofos, and ofc feeders. That's your class of reasons why you'd lose other than things that can't be helped (computer/router/internet hookups/not having a ward up and getting ganked etc, mostly things that if they didn't happen, you'd be 50/50 to win that team fight).

Nope to what? If you're AFK, DC'd, underskilled, or feeding, you're failing at teamwork. If you can't speak the same language as your teammates, that doesn't help either. Not cursing is something *you* can do, though, to help your team work as a team. You can't control that idiot Jinx feeding in bot lane, but you can control your teamward reaction to it.

I played 43 normals a while back =- 37 of them had an Afk, quitter, or just plain non-connector.

That's a lot of games to lose due to things other than controllable reactions.
So what? That's not in any way relevant to how your negativity affects your team, and it's still not something you can control.
Unless you say the cuss words in a positive manner. that was f***ing awesome dude! ur f***ing mlg dude!!!!!

\*Your Jinx has gotten a pentakill\*

> SecretAgentHulk (Mundo): FUCK YEAH
Report mundo for throwing the game by swearing.

Everyone knows that the tips are just psychological colour conditioning... the actual words don't matter, what matters is the colour of the text and the placement... they're just trying to subtly alter your mood prior to the game. That's why most of them are bland statistics that most people would barely even take a second glance at.
